abstract: Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire financier, has invested $50 million in a wireless content startup, Motricity. Motricity, which announced in August it plans to raise $75 million from investors, said it has completed the equity funding agreement with Mr. Icahn through “an affiliated company.” Mr. Icahn’s son, Brett Icahn, an investment analyst with New York-based Icahn Associates and a number of affiliated companies, will join Motricity’s board of directors as a result of the investment.
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire financier, has invested $50 million in a wireless content startup, Motricity. Motricity, which announced in August it plans to raise $75 million from investors, said it has completed the equity funding agreement with Mr. Icahn through “an affiliated company.” Mr. Icahn’s son, Brett Icahn, an investment analyst with New York-based Icahn Associates and a number of affiliated companies, will join Motricity’s board of directors as a result of the investment.
